info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 9:27PM CDT until November 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL CADDO PARISH IN NORTHWESTERN LOUISIANA AND EAST CENTRAL HARRISON COUNTIES... At 927 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Waskom, or 12 miles east of Marshall, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Oil City, Mooringsport, Belcher, Dixie, Caddo Lake, Cross Lake, Cavett, Leigh, Jonesville and Bethany. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
